avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of new snow and a strong wind from westerly directions, extensive wind slabs formed by Wednesday. Even single persons can release avalanches in some places, in particular at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example in particular at intermediate and high altitudes, and on very steep slopes above approximately 2200 m. Such avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on wind-loaded slopes.
Little snow will fall in the late morning. These avalanche prone locations are covered with new snow and are barely recognisable because of the poor visibility.
In very isolated cases the avalanches can be triggered in the weakly bonded old snow and reach large size. Whumpfing sounds serve as an alarm indicating the danger. Backcountry touring and other off-piste activities call for experience and restraint.
avalancheActivity.highlights: On wind-loaded slopes an unfavourable avalanche situation will persist in some regions.

snowpackStructure.comment:
40 to 80 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last five days. The sometimes strong wind has transported some snow.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2400 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions thus far only a little snow is lying.

tendency.highlights: As the day progresses as a consequence of solar radiation there will be a gradual increase in the danger of moist snow slides.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of new snow and a strong wind from westerly directions, extensive wind slabs formed by Wednesday. These represent the main danger. They will be covered with new snow in some cases and therefore difficult to recognise. Single winter sport participants can release avalanches. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example. Additionally in isolated cases avalanches can be released in deep layers and reach quite a large size especially on shady slopes. Whumpfing sounds serve as an alarm indicating the danger.
Backcountry touring and other off-piste activities call for extensive experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and careful route selection.
Caution is to be exercised in particular along the border with Switzerland and in the regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 3 (considerable).
avalancheActivity.highlights: The more recent wind slabs will be covered with new snow in some cases and therefore difficult to recognise.

snowpackStructure.comment:
30 to 50 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last five days. The strong wind has transported the new snow. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack in all aspects.
At low and intermediate altitudes less snow than usual is lying.

tendency.highlights: As the day progresses as a consequence of solar radiation there will be a gradual increase in the danger of moist snow slides.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of a moderate to strong wind from westerly directions, wind slabs formed on Wednesday. They will be covered with new snow and therefore barely recognisable.
Little snow will fall in the late morning. In addition mostly small wind slabs will form adjacent to ridgelines on west, northwest and north facing slopes and generally in the high Alpine regions. The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs can still be released, especially adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas, and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example, in particular on very steep slopes.
Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Be careful, many rocks hidden by fresh snow. The fresh wind slabs are small and in some cases prone to triggering.

regions.name: B - VALLI DI GRESSONEY, AYAS, CHAMPORCHER

snowpackStructure.comment:
20 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last four days. The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2200 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. On steep sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m a little snow is lying. At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is now lying.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack in all aspects.

tendency.highlights: As a consequence of solar radiation, the natural activity of small moist avalanches will increase. From midday as a consequence of solar radiation there will be only a slight increase in the danger of moist snow slides.
